text:
Let's say you have a.jsp and b.jsp

a.jsp: --------------------------------------------------------

1

<%
RequestDispatcher rd = request.getRequestDispatcher("b.jsp");
rd.include(request, response);
%>
	
3
-- End of a.jsp ----------------------------------------------------

b.jsp: -------------------------------------------------------------

2

-- End of b.jsp ----------------------------------------------------

You should get results of: 1 2 3
But you don't. The contents of b.jsp get printed BEFORE anything in a.jsp, 
resulting in: 2 1 3 

I've been trying to use RequestDispatcher's all throughout my code to cleanly 
allow secure jsp's to include content in the middle of non secure jsp's, this 
really halts that effort entirely.
creator: PaulRivers@boundarywaterscanoeing.com
PaulRivers@boundarywaterscanoeing.com

text:
Resin x.x.x shows the same result. 

if you use the jsp:include directive it goes. 
don't use rd directly in a jsp page.

I had a similar problem in the past. The behaviour your seing is (perhaps strangely) according to 
spec (the included buffer being flushed before the includers buffer).

If you want to make this work with request dispatchers, make sure you do a out.flush before 
including the second page (that is what the flush="true" means in the jsp:include tag).

Martin
creator: puckman@taglab.com
